newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: Portugal CPI rises 0.7 pct month-month in May.
newsitem.headline: Portugal CPI rises 0.7 pct month-month in May.

text.p: Portugal's consumer price index (CPI) rose 0.7 percent month-on-month in May, up from 0.2 percent in April, giving a year-on-year increase of 2.1 percent against 1.8 percent the previous month, the National Statistics Institute said.
The rise was higher than analysts' forecasts which had been for a year-on-year increase of between 1.4 and 1.8 percent in May.
The rolling 12-month average rate, the government's benchmark, slowed to 3.0 percent from 3.1 percent in April, the Institute said.
The principal cause of the jump in the month-on-month rate compared with April was food and drink prices which rose 1.1 percent against just 0.2 percent in April and 0.5 percent in May last year.
The following is a sectorial breakdown:
Food and drink +1.1 pct +0.2 pct +0.5 pct
Clothing and shoes +0.1 pct -0.1 pct -0.1 pct
